mdRecord.dcterms:title: Victory at last / Words by Mrs. M.A. Kidder. ; Music by Wm. D. Bradbury. ; From Bradbury's "Golden censer."
For many years we've waited, to hail the day of peace
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Kidder, M. A. (Mary Ann), 1820-1905 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet, with 3 verses and chorus; without music. Printed in black, in 2 columns, on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue. [original]
First lines: For many years we've waited, To hail the day of peace [original]
With advertisement: Ten illustrated Songs on Notepaper, mailed to any Address on receipt of 50 cts. Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St. N.Y." [original]

Hand-colored headpiece, captioned "Charleston, Ft. Sumter" with a wreath, with banner "E Pluribus Unum," around the title; the whole enclosed in a single rule border. Possibly Magnus 62A, which is not pictured in American song sheets. Cf. Library Company of Philadelphia, American song sheets, 2460h. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Twenty-fifth and last of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Soldiers--Songs and music--Texts
United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Peace--Songs and music--Texts
